Package raymarching

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
raymarching.Vector
public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
A 3-dimensional vector.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    double x
    The x coordinate of the vector.
    double y
    The y coordinate of the vector.
    double z
    The z coordinate of the vector.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Vector()
    Creates a new instance of the zero vector.
    Vector​(double[] v)
    Creates a new vector from the values of an array of length 3.
    Vector​(double x, double y, double z)
    Creates a new vector with the coordinates x, y, z.
    Vector​(Vector v)
    Creates a copy of a vector.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Adds the components of another vector to this vector, multiplied by a scaling value.

    Copies the signs of a, b, and c onto the coordinates x, y, and z.

    Divides the vector by a scalar value.

    Computes the length of the vector.

    Reverses a rotation by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z).

    Reverses a rotation by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z) about origin.

    Multiplies the vector by a scalar value.

    Rotates the vector by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z).

    Scales the vector to the specified length.
    void setNegative()
    Takes the negative absolute value of each component individually.
    void setPositive()
    Takes the positive absolute value of each component individually.
    void sign()
    Sets the absolute value of each component to 1, but preserves sign.
    void stretch​(double scalex, double scaley, double scalez)
    Multiplies the x, y, and z coordinates of the vector by scalex, scaley, and scalez respectively.
    void stretch​(Vector v)
    Multiplies the x, y, and z coordinates of the vector by the x, y, and z coordinates of v, respectively.

    Subtracts the components of another vector from this vector.

    Subtracts the components of another vector from this vector.

      y - the y coordinate of the vector
      z - the z coordinate of the vector

      Creates a new vector from the values of an array of length 3.
      Parameters:
      v - an array of three doubles to be the coordinates of the vector

  • Method Details

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(Vector rotation)
      Rotates the vector by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z).
      Parameters:
      rotation - a vector whose coordinates represent the Euler angles phi, theta, and psi by which to rotate

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(Vector rotation, Vector origin)
      Rotates the vector by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z) about origin.
      Parameters:
      rotation - a vector whose coordinates represent the Euler angles phi, theta, and psi by which to rotate
      origin - a vector representing the point about which to rotate

    • inverseRotate

      public void inverseRotate​(Vector rotation)
      Reverses a rotation by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z).
      Parameters:
      rotation - a vector whose coordinates represent the Euler angles phi, theta, and psi by which to rotate

    • inverseRotate

      public void inverseRotate​(Vector rotation, Vector origin)
      Reverses a rotation by the angles (rotation.x, rotation.y, rotation.z) about origin.
      Parameters:
      rotation - a vector whose coordinates represent the Euler angles phi, theta, and psi by which to rotate
      origin - a vector representing the point about which to rotate

    • dotProduct

      public double dotProduct​(double x, double y, double z)
      Computes the dot product of this vector and another.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the other vector
      y - the y coordinate of the other vector
      z - the z coordinate of the other vector
      Returns:
      the dot product of this vector and the vector (x, y, z)

    • stretch

      public void stretch​(double scalex, double scaley, double scalez)
      Multiplies the x, y, and z coordinates of the vector by scalex, scaley, and scalez respectively.
      Parameters:
      scalex - the multiplicative value of the x coordinate
      scaley - the multiplicative value of the y coordinate
      scalez - the multiplicative value of the z coordinate

    • stretch

      public void stretch​(Vector v)
      Multiplies the x, y, and z coordinates of the vector by the x, y, and z coordinates of v, respectively.
      Parameters:
      v - the other vector

      public void sign()
      Sets the absolute value of each component to 1, but preserves sign.
